ratings.comment: Very hard class but he made us understand the material.  This class should be required because it is so helpful.  Good teacher but gives hard exams.

Although this is not an easy class, Bart was a good professor. Do homework and he takes questions for exams directly from worksheets and lecture examples. Reminds me of Professor laskee from Saved by the Bell

Great professor. His lectures are always exciting, as his excitement in proving a new theorem just bubbles over. Extremely funny guy. He is also very helpful during his office hours, taking the time to slowly explain concepts. Exams are a little tough but they are fair. Just work hard, and ask a lot of good questions though and you'll do fine.

if you have to take calc 222, i would highly suggest taking kastermans. relative to the other calc professors he is very good. exams were very easy because all the questions from the exams come right off of his worksheets. and he is very funny so lectures are slightly entertaining.

Very good teacher. Very helpful, stays after class to clear up any questions anyone might have. His tests are quite fair. Very funny guy. I'd say the TA makes all the difference though so get a good TA.
adds humor to lecture

First of all, he is so cute!  I loved his accent and his humor.  Kind of reminded me of Superman, when he's in Clark Kent form.  His teaching was pretty clear for calculus.  Better than most, that is for sure!

I love this man!  Mind you, the class is boring sometimes, but it is worth it go and stay awake for the chance that Bart will say something funny.  Pretty clear, as much as can be expected.  Doing the book work is helpful. Exams aren't too bad, he re-uses questions sometimes, so look at your old tests/homework before exams.  Plus, HOTTIE!

He is pretty funny but sometimes it's hard to stay wake. Some stuff he's pretty clear but with other stuff you should really talk to your T.A. Do the worksheets. The bookwork isn't totally needed but helpful.

Bart is one of the best professors in my life. He really teaches how to do proofs while most math teachers do not. If you are supposed to take 500s proof-based courses, his class would be very helpful.

Bart is superb! He is the best professor I've had yet! Exams are hard, but not extreme. I love his humor, teaching technique, and funny accent.  I can tell he enjoys teaching a lot. Definitely get into his class if you can.
Absolutely amazing professor. He was by far my favorite! He is super funny, and just a good teacher. It's a tough class, but Bart makes it fun!

His lectures can be boring but go by quite fast for a math class.  He makes a lot of mistakes on the bored and it is hard not laugh sometimes.  I'm glad I had Bart and I recommend him to anyone as well with Tete for a TA.
get a good T.A. and u will pass

Exams problems come straight from examples in class or homework problems.  He will answer all questions without hesitation and explains things multiple times if needed.  He also starts every class with a recap of the previous subject.
He is pretty funny and does try hard.  The only problem is that sometimes his lectures can get boring, but I do learn a lot from him.  His exams aren't too hard and aren't too easy.
Usually reviews material at the start of class. Keep up in the (optional) assigned book problems and it should all make sense. (And the Dutch accent/pronunciations keeps it interesting)

A great professor and extremely helpful! His exams are very straightforward and he knows the material for the class well. He is very friendly and will answer any and every question. I would take him for every class if I could.

Bart is a really nice guy.  The class seems really easy, lecture is easy to follow, however the homework takes forever and sometimes is not as easy as it seems.  Although he has a Dutch accent, he is very easy to understand.  He likes to joke a lot in class and make it fun.  Also, he's definitely not bad to look at! ;-)

Though very friendly and readily available for help during office hours, Bart's lectures were often rather confusing.  He tended discuss the material in far too great of detail, and therefore the lessons were difficult to follow.  Exams were beastly, but his cool Dutch accent made up for them!
